Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Anubis61
Reviews.Content: Nobody stays here by his own money i guess. if you are given one room for free by A.airline company - i guess this is the only channel of finding customers- due to some cancelled flight etc, try avoiding this hotel. one star can be given for clean towels and bed linens, however everything else is bad. small rooms, awful walls, not working air condition, sometimes available hot water, sometimes working lift, 3 channel tv with empty battery-remote control, disgusting food. Staff is not professional but i respect them. they have good will but low competence.

Reviews.Title: “4 star with what standard?”
Reviews.Author: Saman1980
Reviews.Content: As for most of the guests , we were sent to this PALACE because our connecting flight delayed and we missed the next plane. The Hotel is not a nightmare but you can only give it 2 star based on the lobby and the restaurant. The rooms are terrible , aging , no safebox , a small old TV that hardly works. The only positive point for the room was the shower. Alitalia offered us coupons for dinner and breakfast. The dinner contains starter , main course and desert but the quality of all of them were about average. At check in they refused to gave us back our passports and put them on a shelf that a thief easily could catch it! After insisting they accepted to give them back to us!

Reviews.Title: “Turn around, find another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 123_God_tur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sad, dirty, depressing and awful!! The room we got was very dirty and totally worn out. Walls was covered with all kinds of dirt. The hallways had carpet wich was covered with layers of dirt. Internet is not included. The tv had terrible signals. Our advice: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? Really? Really?”
Reviews.Author: EarlDGrt
Reviews.Content: Dirty filthy discusting room (141) and I can keep on going. Alitalia missed my connection by arriving 2 hours late and i had to stay for the next flight in the morning. They put me at the "palace" of many decades ago. Since then it was not renovated. If you have a choice do not stay At this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: W R P
Reviews.Content: Alitalia put us here when flight delayed Worst hotel ever--carpet so dirty put bedspreads on floor so we did not have to walk on it

Reviews.Title: “The worst you can expect from an hotel”
Reviews.Author: quintaavila
Reviews.Content: This so called palace hotel is an horrible buiding 15 minutes far from the airport. Rooms are outdated, carpets ar dirty, lights are ugly. Service is not so bad but really this is not at all an hotel where to stay. it is neither a palace , nor near the airport and certainly not a four stars as it says. Also, the shuttle which is supposed to live the airport every 30 minutes only runs every hour in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars??? REALLY??? NOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBLO
Reviews.Content: We referred to this hotel as the: "Alitalia Airlines Hotel for Stranded American Passengers". Alitalia Airlines screwed-up our flight home and had the 'decency'(?) to put us up in this joke of a hotel. Our shuttle was late and by the time we got to the hotel we were offered "lunch" which consisted of whatever was leftover on the 'buffet' table. On top of which, was cold. In fact, dinner was cold as well. The food is nothing more than 'conference' food. I lost my appetite. The room was worn and dirty. The carpeting is stained throughout the hotel. Good luck finding an alternate location for food as there are none nearby. I regretted staying here even if it was free. I could not wait to leave. I would never stay there by choice. The only people staying in this hotel with us were fellow Alitalia Airlines stranded passengers. I guess the hotel doesn't need to bother to remedy anything as long as the airlines keep sending them their stranded passengers.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars - no chance!”
Reviews.Author: Emma J
Reviews.Content: After a flight which was disrupted by the general strike on the 6th September, we were unable to catch a connection to Naples and were eventually offered overnight accommodation with dinner and breakfast in the Airport Palace. It is definitely not a Palace!! We did query the star rating of the hotel at the airport and were assured it was 4 star. We were transported on the coach after 10pm through a less than salubrious appearing area and noted some bars that were still open, but didn't dare venture out! The hotel was appalling, we arrived on a full shuttle with mostly Easyjet passengers all of whom were allocated rooms, by the single member of reception staff that seemed able to do anything (there was another staff member who stood and watched the chaos) while other travellers had to wait. Talking to some Easyjet passengers they had been forced to wait in the lobby for most of the afternoon before the hotel would check them in (administrative problems in the past with Easyjet was given as the reason for this). Our room was tiny, the aircon didn't work, there were dubious stains on the wallpaper - possibly blood, and the bedspreads had seen far better days. To their credit the bathroom was very clean but the towels were awful. The hotel had laid out a buffet dinner, but were unable to keep up with demand for the food, everything was cooked to within an inch of its life but was cold (at least we wouldn't get food poisoning!) the red wine provided was undrinkable. Despite the promise of breakfast after the terrible dinner we decided to cut our losses and give it a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Guilder23
Reviews.Content: After my Sunwing flight was delayed for 10+ hours, we were sent to this hotel. The shuttle was late coming to the airport to pick us up, at least by 30 minutes. The lobby looks clean, but the wallpaper is peeling in the staircase and the rooms are not very clean. My room didn't have a garbage can and there were dried red splatters on the wallpaper in my room, which I suspected was blood. The room was smaller than other what other 4 star hotels offer. The food was nothing special, but not terrible either. I definitely wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, but that's pointless for me to say since this hotel seems to get all its business from stranded passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I'd stay here by choice”
Reviews.Author: debart
Reviews.Content: Had a cancelled flight home & the airline put all the passengers at this hotel, close to Fiumicino Airport. It is located in Ostia, walking distance to the beach & shops, so location was good for the purpose. The restaurant food & service was excellent! They put out a lovely spread & serviced wine for the stranded passengers - dinner, breakfast & lunch - huge selection & delicious! The rooms were simple. My room was clean & the amenities worked, once I got into my room (the handle fell off in my hand). The front desk staff were unfortunately overwhelmed but did their best to accomodate everyone - so I say Kudos to the hotel/restaurant staff! as 3 plane loads checked into this hotel on the same night!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING. RUN. DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: DeeNewYork
Reviews.Content: How in the world can anyone call this hotel “ok”? This place is a filthy, frightening, unsafe dump. It is the worst hotel I’ve ever seen in my life. Alitalia cancelled our flight and the representative had the gall to assure our 6 women travelers that this was a “4-star” hotel when we inquired. I’d like to see her send her mother to this place. Bad karma, my dear. Wallpaper in the hallways literally peeled and hanging. The smell of disinfectant spray overwhelming from the first time you open the door to the hotel making it impossible to get a clean breath of air. Dim, dank atmosphere throughout the hotel. The curtains in the lobby crispy with dirt and festooned with webs. We knew we weren’t staying from the start, but looked in the rooms just to be sure. Indescribable. Stained and shiny “bedspreads” (tarps?) over the beds, just filth everywhere. Mold. We should have taken a picture, but were too busy running away to think of it. The place screamed bedbugs and other things I don’t even want to think about. We piled our bags on one of the lobby tables, so as not to have them touch the plastic, stained “sofas”. The front desk attendant, to her credit, actually didn’t speak to us at all, just robotically took our passports on arrival and handed them back as we left as if this is what she does over and over each day. Reminiscent of another weary traveler we watched attempting to access his room, swiping his card over and over, and just getting a red “no access” light. Like the hotel of the damned. Yes, we had the same hotel shuttle bus driver as described by a previous poster, surly was the perfect word, and I’ll repeat it. And yes, he did use his cell phone most of the time while he was driving, making it impossible for us to use our phones because we couldn’t hear over his shouting. We had him drive us back to the airport so we could get the Marriott shuttle. He liked to yell at us, not sure why, don’t care. He works for a toilet, so that’s his world. Escaped to the Courtyard Marriott who put the whole group up – I’m used to this chain from business travel, but must say it was a cut above its usual good standard. We expected clean and safe, but got much much more. Front desk treated us like the weary travelers we were. Smiles and graciousness, even a little humor, thank you! Restaurant was fantastic – clean and stylish, like the rest of the hotel. We had a lovely dinner, and outstanding breakfast the next morning, a buffet with every conceivable breakfast food, including a selection of different kinds of granolas, juices, yogurts, all kinds of fresh fruit in addition to all kinds of cereal, hot eggs and meats, cheeses, pastries. Beds were super comfortable, bathroom sparkling clean and a great Grohe shower. Front desk kindly provided us with some basics that we were missing. Business center was set up comfortably, and we were able to get everything done there. Hotel even provides multi-country voltage converters built in to the outlets. That was really helpful! Save yourself the horrible experience, especially if you are a woman traveler, your safety is so much more important than a free room. In fact, if you can’t afford it, just stay at the airport, that would be safer and at least you can get the basics with food and bathrooms. And thank you, thank you, Courtyard Marriott Rome FCO!

Reviews.Title: “You laugh so you don't cry.”
Reviews.Author: retro46
Reviews.Content: I had a long stopover in Rome so decided to find a hotel for day use rather than drag myself round the terminals. Words really cannot describe it - The only thing I can say that is positive is that the bathroom was cleaner than the toilets in Rome airport. Which is not really saying very much. We were picked up by the shuttle bus - the 15 minutes I was told it takes were considerably more. Try 40. The hotel - It is not a 4 star. In fact it should not have any stars at all. One guy at reception answering the telephone and checking people in and out. Obviously not thrilled by his job judging by his general attitude and frankly I cannot blame him. I had to wait for him to answer x number of phone calls before I checked in. The room - dilapidated is actually a polite description. The archaic TV worked once I realised that everything was unplugged at the back. It was a hovel actually. Disgusting carpets, a bed spread that made you think twice about sitting on it. The furniture was falling to pieces and the room stank of air freshener. I decided to go down to the bar - which they had according to their info sheet. When I asked the guy at reception if they had one he laughed like I had asked whether they have a spa -which would have been very funny given the quality of the hotel - and said no Madame. So I had to go out along some singularly uninviting streets to find somewhere to have a coffee and something to eat. I decided to leave on the shuttle bus half an hour earlier having seen the traffic - If I had not been lucky enough to find a taxi I would still be waiting for it as it never appeared and I would have missed my flight.I was cheerfully assured by someone not to worry - that it would eventually come and that it is always late. It took me at least 25 mins to check out as the reception was inundated - I was 2nd in line but the receptionist was still on phone duty too. If I had been staying there for the night I would have left as I arrived. I was charged 100 Euro for the privilege of using the room. Frankly if they gave me the room free and promised to pay me to stay there I wouldn't. Avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “A good traveling experience; could've been much worse”
Reviews.Author: Stroh_99
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled due to mechanical problems with the plane. I was traveling with my family, and we have two young kids ages 2 & 4. It had already been a long day, because of the delays, and we were a little relieved when they finally cancelled the flight (i.e. the kids were getting restless and tired and in need of a nap). The airline bused everyone on the flight to the Airport Palace Hotel for the night. The hotel sign does have 4 stars on the marquee, but it is obviously dated. The hotel staff quickly got everyone a room and a lunch buffet was setup and waiting after we dropped off our luggage in our room. Was it a great meal? No, of course not. The hotel had 300+ tired people check in with little notice. Was it satisfying? Yes, and they did keep bringing bottles of wine coming to the table. I am guessing that this hotel is only a refuge for stranded flyers, and has contracts with the airlines. I can't see anyone ending up at this hotel on their own. I have to laugh at some of the other reviews. Our room was clean, and the staff was trying hard to please. Bumped passengers are not people you want to deal with in the sevice industry. We asked a bell hop for directions to a nearby market to buy some milk for our two young kids. There was not a store close by that we could walk to. So the staff guy offers to run down the street to their sister hotel to get us a liter of milk. The guy gets the milk for us, and doesn't want to take any money for it. I gave him some euros regardless, and I appreciated his eagarness to help us out. The neighborhood? At first sight, I thought of a Chicago working class neighborhood with the numerous apartment buildings and the laundry hanging out to dry and kids hanging out at street corners. After eating, my wife, kids and I took a stroll around the neighborhood. We found a nice little park a few blocks away for the kids to play in, and we picked up some great dessert treats in a little family run bakery. We talked to some locals at the park, and everyone was super friendly. I never enjoy flight delays or cancellations, but I feel like it was a good experience for my family, and I think it will make us hardier travelers in the future. We met some interesting people, and the hotel was fine. I have slept in a wide variety of accommodations; park benches to the Four Seasons. This hotel was fine, and it offered an experience I will remember. Some of the complaints overheard from other guests were whiney and over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staff, Gaugers, Crap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TangyEvents
Reviews.Content: The rudest staff in Italy. They barked at me when I asked for assistance. Tried to gauge their guest during the Volcano Crisis. Throwing out families at midnight, to try to get an extra buck. I was a paying customer and got yelled at and things thrown at me. In a bad part of town, close to the airport, the food and restaurant staff were awful. If you know what is good for you stay far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping factory”
Reviews.Author: Scincus
Reviews.Content: Stranded in Rome due the ash cloud from Iceland. After a day hanging on the airport KLM offered us this hotel. Buses full with stranded passengers arrived, but only one person behind the desk. The next morning with the checking out, the same story. There was only one elevator working. In the room the only thing that was of a good quality was the bathroom. The staff was not very friendly or hospitable. This is a hotel where you do not go voluntarily.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked!”
Reviews.Author: u2rocksbb97
Reviews.Content: I have seen better rooms in a rancid crackhouse. Our flight was screwed bu Alitalia and this was there idea of accomodating my family. mid summer, no a/c, rancid food, dirty beds. I made everyone sleep in their clothes , showers were nasty and staff was worse. If it wasnt midnight when we arrived I would have paid to stay somewhere else. So if this is where u intend on staying wear a garbage bag on your body, and cover your head. For breakfast eat toothpaste and you will be safer. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Got bumped unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: HopAlot9
Reviews.Content: I received one free night at this hotel after getting bumped by an airline. I wouldn't recommend to stay here. I arrived at 1am in January and landed a room on the second floor. The room was freezing, with no way to adjust the heat. It appears the cleaning staff left the window open. Internet costs 20 Euros for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Average in all regards--geared towards the groups.”
Reviews.Author: relambjr
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for one evening when we volunteered to get bumped from a delayed flight. It seems the entire clientele is there due to airlines or tour groups. We had no problems with service, cleanliness, the room or the food fortunately. The location is near the airport and the free shuttle from the airport (look for the big gray buses) is very handy. It is also near the train into Rome--the purpose of our detour there. For one euro you can take a train all the way into Rome. Our trip to the Vatican was about 35 minutes long, including the transfer from the train to the subway. The neighborhood for the hotel is very quiet, and by 7 p.m. all the stores and even restaurants were closing up. Very odd. there are a couple stores nearby for needed toiletries (for stuck air passengers) and an Internet cafe, but it was closed when I went by. The room was small, but functional. No complaints. The free dinner the airline provided us at the hotel was served buffet style and by the time we got there, a large group had cleaned out most of it. Honestly, after a bonus beautiful day in Rome sightseeing, all we really needed was the free wine on the table and were were good! If I had been counting on dinner I would have been very disappointed. We were worried about the signs warning of limited bus capacity in the morning for our flight, so we got to breakfast right at 5:45 when it opened and had no problems or complaints about the food. Very competent, self service buffet style breakfast. The staff is obviously well equipped and experienced at dealing in volume. The hotel has a computer for use, but is very expensive Internet at .35 euro per minute. There is a decent bar off to the side of the lobby, where we saw many of our fellow travelers. I didn't have a chance to check out nor use any other amenities. One thing i would highly recommend for an afternoon layover at this hotel if you are inclined--a trip to the ruins at Ostia Antica. this is only one train stop from the hotel's Ostia Nord, and Ostia represents ancient Rome's port city and is a beautiful, excavated city. Think Pompeii but not nearly as big or crowded (and without the human tragedy of the volcano of course). it is a relaxing way to see Roman history. Overall, I am fortunate we didn't experience any of the problems of our fellow travelers at the Airport Palace Hotel. I would certainly go out of my way to book a stay here, but I have no reservations at all about it for an airport layover or on a group tour. It is perfectly fine for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: barbaraapc
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Rome to Newark was delayed 25 hours due to engine trouble, so Continental bussed several 100 of us to this facility. The desk help could not have been less helpful and the rooms were disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't really recommend”
Reviews.Author: cpyoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only because our flight was delayed and the airline put us up there till 11pm so we'd have a place to rest until we had to go back to the airport. While we didn't technically stay the "night" and can't comment on that part, the bed seemed ok for the nap we took. I wouldn't give it the 4 star it says it's rated (on their sign) as it was smaller and not as nice as the 3 star one we had initially stayed in. I guess it was a decent size given what people say about European hotels though. First, they weren't prepared to let anyone check into their rooms. While I understand there was a whole lot of us who arrived, probably last minute, there must have been some rooms that were ready/not used that people could check into. The tv didn't work at all. If I weren't so tired and frustrated over the 14 hour delay, I probably would have complained more. There was also a bug, kind of looking like a beetle or cockroach in the bath tub. We had to flush it down with the shower. There was some mold along the tub as well. I was glad we weren't staying the whole night. The room had a bit of a smell as well.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stroberk80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Airport Palace hotel two days before and we were a bit worried as I almost always read bad things about this hotel. According to us this hotel is very clean, beautiful and the staff is also very helpful and friendly. The rooms are not so big but well-equipped and the bathrooms are clean and you are also given lots of towels. We were taken to this hotel as our flight from Rome was cancelled and as many other passengers of Alitalia we were transferred here with the free shuttlebus from Fiumicino airport. The dinner was quite good, only the salad was frozen a bit. Breakfast was much better as you could eat as much as you wanted to and you had a great variety of choices: crossiant, other bakery things, lots of tea, juices, coffee, cappuccino, cold cuts, chese, fresh rolls, cereals, jams.... we were absolutely full after breakfast:-)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near fuminchino airport”
Reviews.Author: world_treker1
Reviews.Content: our fnight light from rome to athens with alitalia was cancel due to heavy snow in athens. so alitalia pick all the passengers to this hotel for spending the night there. hotels is about 15 min by car from fuminchino airport,but hotel provide a free shuttle bus from airport to hotel and vise versa every 30 minutes. rooms are average size room provide us all the necessary breakfast was a typical hotel breakfast depsite we stay there only for 1 night by luck i can say it's a good hotel in an nice area

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mari0m
Reviews.Content: The worst problem in this hotel is its staff. Unhelpfull and unforgiving in the quest to achieve nothing for their guests. A good description for this hotel would be " circling vultures". I have unfortunately had to stay a while within its walls but never again. The untruths and constant battles with billing of internet services. The creative accounting for meals. The lack of access to telephone or even a power sockets. I never had problems with cleaning on the 6th floor. Just the broken lifts which prevented me getting to it. This place has so far left me with a bad taste of Italy a country with a legendly reputation for food. In the palace hotel it would be a myth! If anyone tries to send you here refuse! Even if they have grounded you.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel we stayed in in our life, it is a real dump; half a star”
Reviews.Author: aljagal
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we stayed in in our life, it is a real dump; half a star is more than enough for this garbage. No heaters in the rooms, no towels in the bathrooms, the frozen food they serve is ... frozen, the rooms stink, no electrical plugs, an old 14 inch tv with a worn out remote control with5 italian channels only, nail debris on the carpet, hair in the food....It was a night of hell; we froze, got out at 6am on the first bus (50standing people, 25 seated) to Fiumicino airport although our flight was at 5 pm. Who awarded them the stars ? How can there be such a rip off in Europe?

Reviews.Title: “Makes Fawlty Towers appear a good choice”
Reviews.Author: harshbutfair
Reviews.Content: Booked into the hotel by Alitalia as I was doing some work on their behalf ie no choice of hotel.... I've stayed in hotels the world over and this is actually the worst. Room on fifth floor actually has no power points or desk to work at (obviously not geared towards the business traveller then.) Along with this, reception is chaos, checking in is like trying to get a pint in a London pub on New Years Eve, i also actually had to double check with reception that the restaurant was one and not a soup kitchen. Room & public area filthy. Staff generally have the "why the [--] are you asking me" approach. Please, if you have the choice, don't come here...I will be complaining bitterly to my boss.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Magere1
Reviews.Content: Needed hotel for 12 hours pending flight to Tokyo. Booking agent at airport arranged this "4*" hotel for Euro130. Hotel old and tired and management obviously lacking any concern about maintainence (own footpath had missing cobbles and was full of litter). In fact the whole area was a haven for grafitti and litter. Free transport to airport only saving grace although A/C on bus broken. Would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “It's is a run down dump”
Reviews.Author: charleston1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, but one night is more than enough. At first glance, the lobby appears fine. We got up to our rooms (2) and neither had air conditioning and both stank (apparently they sprayed for bugs). There was black mold on the walls, the carpets were buckled and worn and the walls will worn. They sent maintenance up regarding the no air - later we were told it was because the filters needing changing - HOW DIRTY they must be been to block all the air conditionings. Friends down the hall had more black mold and better still - blood on the sheets. The front desk told them they would have to look into it before giving them a new room. After raising a stink they RELUCTANTLY gave them a new room. The towels INCLUDING the large bath "towel" is actually the exact material as a tea towel. This may have been a 4 star when it opened, but it is definitely not now - it is dirty dirty dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: HermosaBeachTraveler
Reviews.Content: For 170 Euros a night for a 4 Star Hotel, I expected a little more: like clean carpet, air conditioning that worked, and lighting that actually lit up the room. From the looks of the lobby, I was anticipating a great stay! Marble floors, clean & well kept. But our room on the 1st floor was horrible! Could not caution you enough to stay away!

Reviews.Title: “our night of hell”
Reviews.Author: sarahSurrey
Reviews.Content: We too were sent to our doom by Alitalia after missing our connecting flight.After struggling to find the shuttle bus we were forced to pay 22 euros to be taken to this dump.After being advised we were not going to be offered breakfast we decided it was best to take advantage of the dinner being offered.All we can say is that a rat would turn up his nose at the sight of what was on offer and we quickly retreated back to our filthy room with a bread roll each that was so hard you could use it as a bowling ball.Fearing for what we would find under the bedsheets the only option was to sleep on a towel,if thats what you could call it,more like a paper napkin. For all those poor souls yet to miss their flight with Alitalia who will be taken here,we say a prayer for you now.

Reviews.Title: “Black Hairs in Bath tub”
Reviews.Author: ateraxis
Reviews.Content: This establishment is a total rip off and is so poorly organized it could be laughable if it weren't the last or first stop for most people when traveling to Italy. Once you are there you are too tired to find a new place and even if you want to it is nearly impossible to make a local phone call. It is run by young men who still live with their mommies and haven't the slightest clue on how to run a hotel. Do not book this hotel with GTA. The hotel claims they do not work with them so they will not honor a confirmation made with them. Lastly, the hallways reeked and I mean REEKED of bad perfume, the air-conditioning didn't work (we changed rooms 5 times), there were black curly hairs in the tub and the shuttle dropped us all off at the same location without asking what airlines we were with. For all this we paid 115 Euros. Absolutely horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Alitalia's little secret”
Reviews.Author: NanoVolpe
Reviews.Content: If you miss your flight with Alitalia in Rome you will be sent here. It is one of the circles of Hell that Dante discribes. First we miss our flight, then we are shuttled to this creepy dump, fed with left over barely warm and unidentifieable food, told we are to have breakfast but are blessed with them refusing to supply it in time for our shuttle back to the airport. I did not think my room had a window, it was 2x3,heavily draped and viewed a fire escape. The towel would have dried a small plate, not a body. The hotel is a rabbit warren of rooms, the elevator was broken but the lobby was full. I felt so sorry for all the asian tourists until i realized NO ONE except the alitalians would every stay there. They too were among the banished. Waiting to retrieve my passport I spotted a uniform and realized there was a chance my pilot might have attempted sleep here too...shuddered. search the web...there is more on this place

Reviews.Title: “human filth”
Reviews.Author: ednabutch
Reviews.Content: There is no dirt worse than human filth. This hotel has a collection of human filth that I have not seen since I was in the slums of Calcutta in 1998. A cleaning product has not seen the Airport Palace in many years. This is absolutely the most disgusting building I have ever been in. The carpet is stickier than a flytrap. The drapes are disintegrating. The drain in the shower was stopped up and a mixture began to ooze from the drain that reminded me of drool coming from the mouth of Jaba the Hutt. This place is dangerous. Staying in this hotel is a cruelty that no human deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay here”
Reviews.Author: jeffbob
Reviews.Content: Terrible rooms. Very unclean. After seeing the rooms we debated staying in the airport overnight. Since the TV's didn't work we had cockroach races in the hallway (I am not kidding!). We accidently got off on the wrong floor and felt as if we stepped into an insane asylum. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I have been in better hotels in third world countries with no economy. If AlItalia offers you to stay in this place, refuse.

Reviews.Title: “Problem with room exchange, warning for non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChang
Reviews.Content: We were assigned this hotel by Alitalia when our flight to New York was cancelled. My parents were assigned a double room, 414, which does not have a working lock. Your can only lock your room from inside. My sister and I were assigned another double room 415, which has a overwhelming smell of cigarette and air freshener. When we checked in, we specifically asked for non-smoking rooms, and the reservationist said that this hotel has a non-smoking policy. So when we explain the situation, we were hoping that the hotel will assign us a new room as most hotels will do, but this endeavor took us almost 2 hours. The reservationist told us that because the hotel is near its capacity they won't exchange our room until most of the guests have checked in. They finally agreed to move us to another room around 6:00pm. If we do not have this problem, we would said that this hotel is average, since the new room assigned to my sister and I is clean, medium in size, the bathroom is faily new and the shower stall size is average (for an European hotel). The food in the dining room tasted O.K., but I don't know how hygienic is the food preparation process in the kitchen, my family all feel some what ill the next day. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “No facilities!”
Reviews.Author: 150,000_miles_a_year
Reviews.Content: I was put up at this hotel by a business partner for a meeting in Rome. The room was very small, not even with a desk to work at. And although there was wireless internet availabe there was no power plug (!) so I had to unplug the TV to charge the computer. The bathroom was refurbished and modern but the shower was so small that I could barely turn around inside it. One positive remark however: the restaurant has good authentic Italian food at a good price and although the selection is limited it was a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “I too missed my Alitalia flight”
Reviews.Author: RLCaruso
Reviews.Content: Traveler from Boston,MA I also missed my connecting flight due to Alitalia and was put up at the Airport Palace Hotel. I waited for about 1 1/2 hours until the bus finally picked a group of us up at the airport. We were told there was an accident on the road but we didn't see anything. The hotel was clean but I would agree that no one offered to take my luggage upstairs to my room, nor did anyone explain how to use the lights in the room (room key needs to be used). Free dinner buffet had alot to be desired; same for breakfast buffet. A large bus group was at the hotel and they dominated the elevators. It took me 15 minutes to get an elevator to the lobby and I missed the bus and needed to wait for the next one.. Front desk staff was not very helpful. I am sure that Alitalia has a special deal with the hotel and if I had a choice would have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claudia69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel after my flight through Rome Fiumicino Airport was delayed, and I missed my connection to another destination. The stay was payed by the airline, Alitalia. No way this hotel is 4 star . The room was very small, and there was almost no room to place my luggage. The bed was short and narrow, I could berely stay on it, totaly unsuitable for a person higher than 175 cm. The television was not working. The carpet on the floor was consumed. The surronding area is quite squallid. Few positive aspects: Fiumicino airport is 15 minutes away, and connected through a free shuttle. Sheets and towels were of good quality and very clean. Bathroom recently renovated and large. I would suggest approaching this hotel only in view of an early flight in the morning and only at discounted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near Fiumicino Airport”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCH
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is located just a few minutes from Rome's main airport and has obviously been established to meet the needs of travelers who want to stay near the airport rather than in Rome itself. The neighborhood does not have much to offer but fortunately the hotel is only 1 kilometer from the railroad station, so getting into downtown Rome is not difficult. You should plan on at least 30 minutes to make the trip to the train station since there is at least one change from the train to the subway. The staff is only moderately accommodating and upon check-in, never offered to take our luggage to our room. There are 2 restaurants, a bar, and a large sitting area. Our room was rather small for 4 star standards, but did have a mini-bar, a hair dryer and internet access. The breakfast buffet included cereal, ham, cheese, apples, and several types of bread. It was not what I would expect a 4 star hotel to offer. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport from 8am to 5 pm. The trip is less than 15 minutes.

HotelInfo.Name: Airport Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Romagnoli 165, 00121 Rome, Italy
